perturbation.original_text: 8.1 ANY PROTOTYPES, MATERIALS, COMPONENT PARTS, DESIGNS, SPECIFICATIONS, KNOW-HOW, PROCEDURES, PROCESSES, DATA, INFORMATION, INVENTIONS AND WORK PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT BY EITHER PARTY, ARE PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. EACH PARTY SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTY OF NONINFRINGEMENT OF PATENTS, COPYRIGHTS, OR ANY OTHER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHT.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 ANY PROTOTYPES, MATERIALS, COMPONENT PARTS, DESIGNS, SPECIFICATIONS, KNOW-HOW, PROCEDURES, PROCESSES, DATA, INFORMATION, INVENTIONS AND WORK PERFORMED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT BY EITHER PARTY, ARE PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED. EACH PARTY SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY WARRANTY OF NONINFRINGEMENT OF PATENTS, COPYRIGHTS, OR ANY OTHER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHT.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the disclaimer of implied warranties of MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, the contract becomes potentially non-compliant with consumer protection laws, particularly the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which implies these warranties in many commercial transactions unless explicitly and conspicuously disclaimed. This omission creates legal risk, especially if the products developed under this agreement are sold to consumers and fail to meet basic quality or fitness standards. Under the UCC in Texas, these disclaimers have specific requirements for conspicuousness, and removing them exposes iBio to potential liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranties of Merchantability and Fitness for a Particular Purpose; Texas Business and Commerce Code

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Attorney's Fees. In the event that any claim, suit, action or proceeding is instituted or commenced by any Party hereto against any other Party arising out of or related to this Agreement, the prevailing Party will be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees, expert fees, expenses and court costs from the non-prevailing Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Attorney's Fees. In the event that any claim, suit, action or proceeding is instituted or commenced by any Party hereto against any other Party arising out of or related to this Agreement, each party will bear their own attorney's fees, expert fees, expenses and court costs regardless of the outcome.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the clause so that each party is responsible for their own legal costs regardless of who wins the dispute, the contract is weakening the possibilities for the prevailing party to be fully compensated for being wronged. Certain consumer protection laws, may require a prevailing consumer to recover attorney's fees and costs. This shift could introduce legal challenges, particularly in cases where CC-Pharming (likely the more powerful party) sues iBio, making it financially prohibitive for iBio to defend itself even if it has a valid claim or defense. This change contradicts the intent of statutes designed to ensure fair access to justice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially various state and federal consumer protection laws which provide for attorney fee shifting to protect weaker parties.

perturbation.original_text: 9.13 Governing Law. This Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Texas, without regard to the conflict of laws provisions thereof. Any proceedings to resolve disputes relating to this Agreement shall be brought only in the State of Texas and in a U.S. federal court if there is jurisdiction. The United Nations' Convention on International Sales of Goods does not apply.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.13 Governing Law. This Agreement is governed by the laws of the State of Texas, without regard to the conflict of laws provisions thereof. Any proceedings to resolve disputes relating to this Agreement shall be brought only in the location chosen by CC-Pharming. The United Nations' Convention on International Sales of Goods does not apply.
perturbation.explanation: By providing CC-Pharming the power of choosing the location of where disputes are resolved, there may be a chance that iBio will have to resolve any disagreements in a location that is inconvenient to them. There are consumer protection laws (depending on what this agreement is for) that protects small businesses from being taken advantage of by a corporation by ensuring that the dispute resolution must be local or in a neutral area.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal laws that protect small businesses from corporations.
